fields.headline: Bolton 1 - 0 Tottenham
fields.bodyText: Jay Jay Okocha scored from an injury time penalty to give Bolton Wanderers a 1-0 home win over Tottenham Hotspur and lift them out of the Premiership relegation zone. Bolton were rewarded for their greater attacking enterprise and better chances when Spurs defender Gary Docherty brought down French midfielder Youri Djorkaeff and the Nigerian steered the ball past Kasey Keller from the spot. Bolton climbed two points above West Ham United, who now occupy the third relegation spot with seven games to pay. They have 32 points compared to West Ham's 30, while West Bromwich Albion and Sunderland aresurely doomed, adrift as they are with 21 and 19 points respectively. In a fast and furious second half, Keller made several good saves, one brilliant one from substitute Pierre-Yves Andre, while Bolton's Icelandic defender Gudni Bergsson headed against a post.
